title.narrative: 3.3 Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: Emergency-affected people are provided with lifesaving Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) interventions, especially women and girls., which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Sanitation, Water, Water (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, increased numbers of people, especially girls and women, socially excluded groups and others in vulnerable situations, are healthy and live in resilient communities, access affordable and equitable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services and abandon open defecation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Emergency-affected people are provided with lifesaving WASH interventions, especially women and girls.

description.narrative: Through UNICEF’s life-saving interventions, 870,734 people, or 109% of the target, were able to access safe drinking water by the end of 2020, through water trucking-vouchers and routine, chlorination treatments of water sources; 208,183 people received appropriate sanitation, and 730,864 people were reached with hygiene kits, including, 105,946 women and adolescent girls who received menstrual-health and hygiene-management kits, while 1,024,492 people were reached with hygiene promotion drives, using different techniques such as house-to-house visits, media broadcasting and vehicles mounted with megaphones - all raising hygiene awareness in communities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2020
